item.title: Vim file type specific settings
item.description: If you want to run some vim script for a specific file type, don’t make an auto command. They get messy really quickly. Just edit ~/.vim/ftplugin/<filetype>.vim. ftplugin stands for file type plugin To get the file type of the current file, just do: :set filetype? It’ll be automatically sourced when you open a file of that specific type. Edit matching file Most of the time, you’ll find yourself wanting to edit the ftplugin file of the current filetype.
